lines.content: * The main entry point of the Zenn task management application.
* Initializes the storage, task list, and user interface components,
* and runs the main command loop, allowing users to interact with the application.
* Initializes the Zenn application with necessary components:
* UI, storage, task list, command factory, and parser.
* If loading tasks from storage fails, a new task list is created.
* Runs the main command loop of the Zenn application.
* It continuously reads user input, parses the command, and executes it until the user quits the application.
* Main method to launch the Zenn application.
* @param args Command line arguments (unused in this application).
* Represents a command that exits the application.
* It displays a goodbye message and terminates the program.
* Constructs a ByeCommand to exit the application.
* @param arguments The arguments passed from the user (not used for this command).
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
* Executes the bye command. It shows a goodbye message to the user
* Represents an abstract command in the application.
* Commands are used to perform specific actions in the application
* based on user input. Each command has associated arguments
* and must implement the {@code execute} method to define the action.
* Constructs a Command with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments The arguments passed by the user when executing the command.
* Executes the command. Each subclass must provide its own implementation
* of this method to define the specific action that the command performs.
* Creates the appropriate command based on the type of command specified by the user.
* It helps decouple the command creation logic from the main program flow.
* Constructs a CommandFactory with the given task list, storage, and user interface.
* @param tasks The task list used to manage tasks.
* @param storage The storage used to save and load tasks.
* @param ui The user interface used to interact with the user.
public CommandFactory(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Creates a command based on the provided command type and arguments.
* @param commandType The type of command to create (e.g., "done", "todo", "deadline").
* @param arguments The arguments passed with the command.
* @return A new {@code Command} object corresponding to the specified command type.
public Command createCommand(String commandType, String arguments) {
return new DoneCommand(arguments, tasks, storage, ui);
return new UnmarkCommand(arguments, tasks, storage, ui);
return new TodoCommand(arguments, tasks, storage, ui);
return new DeadlineCommand(arguments, tasks, storage, ui);
return new EventCommand(arguments, tasks, storage, ui);
return new DeleteCommand(arguments, tasks, storage, ui);
* Represents a command that adds a deadline task to the task list.
* It parses the arguments to get the description and deadline date,
* and creates a new deadline task which is then added to the task list.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand to add a deadline task to the task list.
* @param arguments The arguments passed from the user, which should include description and deadline date.
* @param tasks The TaskList object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object used for saving tasks.
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
public DeadlineCommand(String arguments, TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Executes the deadline command. It parses the deadline task arguments, creates a new Deadline task,
* and adds it to the task list. If the format is incorrect, an error message is shown.
ui.showError("Invalid deadline format. Please provide a description and a deadline date.");
ui.showMessage("The correct format for a deadline task is: 'description /by d/M/yyyy HHmm'");
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("Error creating deadline task. Please check the format.");
* Represents a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* It parses the arguments to determine the task index and removes the specified task.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand to delete a task from the task list.
* @param arguments The arguments passed from the user, which should be the task index.
* @param tasks The TaskList object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object used for saving tasks after deletion.
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
public DeleteCommand(String arguments, TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Executes the delete command. It parses the task index from the arguments,
* removes the specified task, and updates the task list in storage.
* If an invalid task index is provided, an error message is shown.
ui.showError("Please provide a valid task number.");
ui.showError("Invalid task index. Please enter a valid task number.");
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've removed this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("Invalid task index format. Please enter a valid number.");
* Represents a command that marks a task as completed.
* It parses the task index and marks the task at the given index as done.
* Constructs a DoneCommand with the specified arguments, task list,
* @param arguments The arguments passed from the user, which should be the task index.
* @param tasks The TaskList object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object used for saving tasks.
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
public DoneCommand(String arguments, TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Executes the command to mark the task at the specified index as done.
* If the task index is invalid or the format is incorrect, an error message is displayed.
ui.showMessage("Wah! Good Job, so productive, this task is marked as done:");
ui.showError("Invalid task index format. Please enter a valid number.");
* Represents a command that adds an event task to the task list.
* It parses the arguments to get the description and event date,
* and creates a new event task which is then added to the task list.
* Constructs a EventCommand to add an event task to the task list.
* @param arguments The arguments passed from the user, which should include description and event date.
* @param tasks The TaskList object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object used for saving tasks.
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
public EventCommand(String arguments, TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Executes the event command. It parses the event task arguments, creates a new Event task,
* and adds it to the task list. If the format is incorrect, an error message is shown.
ui.showError("Invalid event format. Please provide a description, start time, and end time.");
ui.showMessage("The correct format for an event task is: 'description /from d/M/yyyy HHmm /to d/M/yyyy HHmm'");
Event event = new Event(description, fromDateTime, toDateTime);
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("Error creating event task. Please check the format.");
* Represents a command that allows the user to find tasks in the task list based on a given keyword.
* The command searches through task descriptions and displays the tasks that contain the keyword.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified UI, task list, and search keyword.
* @param ui the UI object to handle user interaction and display results.
* @param taskList the task list that contains the tasks to search through.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for in the task descriptions.
public FindCommand(Ui ui, TaskList taskList, String keyword) {
* Executes the find command, which searches for tasks in the task list based on the keyword.
* Displays the matching tasks to the user via the UI.
ui.showError("Missing keyword. Please specify a keyword.");
* Represents a command that lists all the tasks in the task list.
* It displays each task's index and description.
* Constructs a ListCommand to list the tasks from the task list.
* @param arguments The arguments passed from the user.
* @param tasks The TaskList object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
public ListCommand(String arguments, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Executes the list command. It displays all tasks in the task list.
* If there are no tasks present, a message is shown indication there
* are no tasks. If there is an error, an error message is shown.
ui.showError("Error retrieving task as index " + (i + 1) + ": " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a command that adds a task to the task list.
* It parses the arguments to get the description and creates
* a new task which is then added to the task list.
* Constructs a TodoCommand to add a task to the task list.
* @param arguments The arguments passed from the user, which should include description.
* @param tasks The TaskList object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object used for saving tasks.
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
public TodoCommand(String arguments, TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Executes the todo command. It parses the task arguments,
* creates a new Todo task, and adds it to the task list.
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents all unknown command that is not specified.
* It displays an error message to inform users that the entered
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
* Executes the unknown command. It shows an error message to the user.
ui.showError("Unknown command! Please enter a valid command.");
* Represents a command that marks a task as incomplete.
* It parses the task index and marks the task at the given index as not done.
* Constructs a UnmarkCommand with the specified arguments, task list,
* @param arguments The arguments passed from the user, which should be the task index.
* @param tasks The TaskList object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object used for saving tasks.
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying messages to the user.
public UnmarkCommand(String arguments, TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Executes the command to mark the task at the specified index as not yet done.
* If the task index is invalid or the format is incorrect, an error message is displayed.
ui.showError("Invalid task index format. Please enter a valid number.");
* Represents a custom exception for the Zenn application.
* This exception is thrown when a specific error occurs within the application.
* Constructs a new ZennException with the specified detail message.
* @param exception The detail message, which provides additional information about the error.
* Represents the command parser for the Zenn application.
* This class is responsible for parsing user input, splitting the input into a command and its arguments,
* and then using the CommandFactory to create the corresponding Command object.
* Constructs a Parser object with the given CommandFactory.
* @param commandFactory The CommandFactory used to create commands based on user input.
public Parser(CommandFactory commandFactory, Ui ui, TaskList taskList) {
* Parses the user input to extract the command and its arguments,
* and returns the corresponding Command object.
* @param userInput The input string from the user, which consists of the command and optional arguments.
* @return A Command object that corresponds to the parsed user input.
* Represents the storage system for tasks in the Zenn application.
* This class is responsible for loading and saving tasks to a file.
* It uses a predefined file path and provides methods to read and write task data.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
* Saves a list of tasks to the storage file.
* Each task is written in a specific format to the file, one task per line.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* The file is read line by line and tasks are recreated from the stored data.
* If the file doesn't exist, an empty list is returned.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from the storage file.
* @throws ZennException If there is an error while loading the tasks.
public static ArrayList<Task> loadTasks() throws ZennException {
throw new ZennException("Error loading tasks: " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a deadline task, which includes a description and a due date.
* A deadline task has a specific time and date by which it must be completed.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
private static final DateTimeFormatter FILE_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/MM/yyyy HHmm");
* Constructs a Deadline object with a description and a due date.
* @param description A brief description of the deadline task.
* @param by The LocalDateTime representing the deadline's due date and time.
* Checks if the deadline task is on a specific date.
* @param date The date to check against the deadline.
* @return True if the deadline is on the specified date, false otherwise.
* Converts the deadline task into a string format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return The string representation of the deadline task for file storage.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task for display to the user.
* @return The string representation of the deadline task.
* Represents an event task, which includes a description, a start date and end date.
* An event task has a specific duration in which the event takes place.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
* Constructs an Event object with a description, a start date and end date.
* @param description A brief description of the event.
* @param from The LocalDateTime representing the event's start date and time.
* @param to The LocalDateTime representing the event's end date and time.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Checks if the event task is on a specific duration.
* @param date The date to check against the duration.
* @return True if the duration is on the specified date, false otherwise.
* Converts the event task into a string format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return The string representation of the event task for file storage.
* Returns a string representation of the event task for display to the user.
* @return The string representation of the event task.
* Represents a generic task with a description, completion status, and a task type.
* Subclasses of Task will represent specific task types, such as Todo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs a Task object with a description and a task type.
* The task is initially not marked as done.
* @param description A brief description of the task.
* @param type The type of the task (e.g., Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Returns a string representing the task's status icon.
* The status icon is "X" if the task is done, otherwise it's a space.
* @return The status icon ("X" for done, space for not done).
* The task's status will be set to done, and the status icon will be updated.
* The task's status will be set to incomplete, and the status icon will be updated.
* Converts the task to a string format suitable for saving to a file.
* This method must be implemented by subclasses to return the task's file format.
* @return A string representing the task in file format.
* Returns a string representation of the task for display to the user.
* The string includes the status icon and the task description.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manage and retrieve tasks.
* The TaskList class allows adding, removing, and retrieving tasks by index, as well as checking the list size.

* Adds a task to the TaskList.
* @param task The task to be added to the list.
* Removes a task from the TaskList at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed.
* @throws ZennException If the index is invalid.
public Task removeTask(int index) throws ZennException {
* Retrieves a task from the TaskList at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* @throws ZennException If the index is invalid (out of bounds).
public Task getTask(int index) throws ZennException {

* Returns a string representation of all tasks in the TaskList.

* Represents the different types of tasks.
* Each task can be of one of the following types: TODO, DEADLINE, or EVENT.
* Represents a Todo task in the application.
* A Todo task is a task that does not have a specific deadline or event time.
* Creates a Todo task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the Todo task.
* Converts the Todo task to a format suitable for saving to a file.

* The string format includes the task type and description, along with the completion status.

* Represents the user interface for the Zenn application.
* This class is responsible for displaying messages to the user and reading user input.
* It handles various interactions, including welcoming the user, reading commands,
* displaying messages, and showing error messages.
* Constructs a Ui object, initializing the scanner to read from standard input.
* Reads the next line of user input from the console.
* @return The command inputted by the user.
* Displays a welcome message and the application's logo to the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm \n" + logo + "\n What you need help with?");
